intro: Urena subtriloba, commonly known as the three-lobed urena, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are deeply lobed and often arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Urena subtriloba is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
